author: Bengaluru: Oct 20
title: Adrian opens in fine fashion
text:
Adrian opens in fine fashion Bengaluru: Oct 20, 2015, DHNS: Top-seed Adrian Menandez-Maceiras of Spain had no trouble is seeing off the challenge of Petros Chrysochos of Cyprus in the opening round of the Air Asia Open ATP Challenger tennis tournament, here at the KSLTA stadium on Monday. 

The 29-year-old took just over an hour and 15 minutes to register a comfortable 6-4, 6-4 win on a sunny morning on centre court.

While India’s participation on the opening day was restricted to the wild-card entrants and the players who came through the qualifiers, the second day wil see top ranked Indians like Saketh Myneni and Somdev Devvarman take the court as they get their campaign under way.

After a string of disappointing results on the Challenger circuit — the last being a pre-quarterfinal appearance at the Vietnam Open that concluded last week — the Spaniard was determined to put up a good show here. 

And he did exactly that by breaking Chrysochos’ serve in the opening game to take an early lead. Riding on his fierce forehand and smart shot selection, the world number 137 looked on course to take the opening set without much trouble before a momentary loss in concentration saw Chrysochos come back into the tie after Adrian gifted the Cypriot a break to level scores at 3-3.

But Chrysochos couldn’t make the most of the opening as Adrian once again went on to impose his authority, breaking his rival’s serve in the seventh game and going on to wrap up the first set with an ace down the middle.

Struggling to get into his rhythm under the bright sun, Chrysochos was no match for his opponent as Adrian once again raced ahead in the second set to take an early lead, breaking Chrysochos’ serve in the first game and then holding his serve to go 2-0 up.

Though the 19-year-old Chrysochos tried to find his way back with a few clever drop shots that had the top-seed in trouble, Adrian, who blasted in four aces and kept the teenager on his toes with his delightful stroke play, retained control to emerge winner.

Divij-Neuchrist ousted
However, all was not lost for Chrysochos as he, along with Temur Ismailov, beat the top-seed pair of India’s Divij Sharan and Maximillian Neuchrist of Austria 6-7 (3), 7-6 (3), 10-7.

Meanwhile, in an all-Indian affair, the Sood brothers –– Chandril and Lakshit, got the better of Somdev Devvarman and Christopher Marquis 7-6 (3), 7-6 (2).

DH News Service 
Results (Prefix denote seedings): First round: Singles: 1-Adrian Menendez-Maceiras (Esp) bt Petros Chrysochos (Cyp) 6-4, 6-4; Arthur De Greef (Bel) bt Suraj R Prabodh (Ind) 6-3, 6-4; 5- Yannick Mertens (Bel) bt N Vijay Sundar Prashanth (Ind) 6-2, 6-2; Prajnesh Gunnerswaran (Ind) bt Mohit Mayur Jayaprakash (Ind) 6-4, 6-3; 6-Ti Chen (Tpe) bt Temur Ismailov (Uzb) 6-2, 6-4; Dane Propoggia (Aus) bt Gerard Granollers (Esp) 6-4, 6-3. 

Doubles: Sumit Nagal (Ind)/ Vishnu Vardhan (Ind) bt Michal Knoecny (Cze)/ Alexander Kudryatsev (Rus) 4-6, 7-6 (4), 10-6; Chandril & Lakshit Sood (Ind) bt Somdev Devvarman (Ind) / Christopher Marquis (Ind) 7-6 (3), 7-6 (2); Petros Chrysochos (Cyp) / Temur Ismailov (Uzb) bt 1-Maximillian Neuchrist (Aur) / Divij Sharan (Ind) 6-7 (3), 7-6 (3), 10-7.
